Package jakarta.nosql.column

Interface ColumnQuery.ColumnQueryBuilder

  • Enclosing interface:
    ColumnQuery
    public static interface ColumnQuery.ColumnQueryBuilder
    Besides, the fluent-API with the select method, the API also has support for creating a ColumnQuery instance using a builder pattern. The goal is the same; however, it provides more possibilities, such as more complex queries. The ColumnQueryBuilder is not brighter than a fluent-API; it has the same validation in the creation method. It is a mutable and non-thread-safe class.

    • Method Detail

      • select

        ColumnQuery.ColumnQueryBuilder select​(String column)
        Append a new column in the search result. The query will return the result by elements declared such as "select column from database" If it remains empty, it will return all the possible fields, similar to "select * from database"
        Parameters:
        column - a field to return to the search
        Returns:
        the ColumnQuery.ColumnQueryBuilder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when the document is null

      • select

        ColumnQuery.ColumnQueryBuilder select​(String... columns)
        Append new columns in the search result. The query will return the result by elements declared such as "select column from database" If it remains empty, it will return all the possible fields, similar to "select * from database"
        Parameters:
        columns - a field to return to the search
        Returns:
        the ColumnQuery.ColumnQueryBuilder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when there is a null element

      • sort

        ColumnQuery.ColumnQueryBuilder sort​(Sort sort)
        Append a new sort in the query. The first one has more precedence than the next one.
        Parameters:
        sort - the Sort
        Returns:
        the ColumnQuery.ColumnQueryBuilder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when the sort is null

      • sort

        ColumnQuery.ColumnQueryBuilder sort​(Sort... sorts)
        Append sorts in the query. The first one has more precedence than the next one.
        Parameters:
        sorts - the array of Sort
        Returns:
        the ColumnQuery.ColumnQueryBuilder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when there is a null sort

      • from

        ColumnQuery.ColumnQueryBuilder from​(String columnFamily)
        Define the column family in the query, this element is mandatory to build the ColumnQuery
        Parameters:
        columnFamily - the column family to query
        Returns:
        the ColumnQuery.ColumnQueryBuilder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when documentCollection is null

      • where

        ColumnQuery.ColumnQueryBuilder where​(ColumnCondition condition)
        Either add or replace the condition in the query. It has a different behavior than the previous method because it won't append it. Therefore, it will create when it is the first time or replace when it was executed once.
        Parameters:
        condition - the ColumnCondition in the query
        Returns:
        the ColumnQuery.ColumnQueryBuilder
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when condition is null

      • skip

        ColumnQuery.ColumnQueryBuilder skip​(long skip)
        Defines the position of the first result to retrieve. It will depend on the NoSQL vendor implementation, but it will discard or skip the search result. The default value is zero, and it will replace the current property.
        Parameters:
        skip - the first result to retrieve
        Returns:
        a query with first result defined
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if limit is negative

      • limit

        ColumnQuery.ColumnQueryBuilder limit​(long limit)
        Defines the maximum number of results to retrieve. It will truncate to be no longer than limit. The default value is zero, and it will replace the current property.
        Parameters:
        limit - the limit
        Returns:
        the ColumnQuery.ColumnQueryBuilder
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if limit is negative

      • build

        ColumnQuery build()
        It will validate and then create a ColumnQuery instance.
        Returns:
        ColumnQuery
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - It returns a state exception when an element is not valid or not fill-up, such as the from(String) method was not called.

      • getResult

        Stream<ColumnEntity> getResult​(ColumnFamilyManager manager)
        Executes ColumnFamilyManager.select(ColumnQuery)
        Parameters:
        manager - the entity manager
        Returns:
        the result of ColumnFamilyManager.select(ColumnQuery)
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when manager is null
        IllegalStateException - It returns a state exception when an element is not valid or not fill-up, such as the from(String) method was not called.

      • getSingleResult

        Optional<ColumnEntity> getSingleResult​(ColumnFamilyManager manager)
        Executes ColumnFamilyManager.singleResult(ColumnQuery)
        Parameters:
        manager - the entity manager
        Returns:
        the result of ColumnFamilyManager.singleResult(ColumnQuery)
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when manager is null
        IllegalStateException - It returns a state exception when an element is not valid or not fill-up, such as the from(String) method was not called.
